H0.text: A hand lens is the tool the student should have used to measure how quickly a car rolled down the hill.

H1.text: A stopwatch is the tool that a student should have used to measure how quickly a car rolled down a hill.

H2.text: A thermometer is the tool that the student should have used to measure how quickly the car rolled down the hill.

H3.text: A centimeter ruler is the tool the student should have used to measure how quickly a car rolled down the hill.

A4.text: The device is used when time periods must be measured precisely and with a minimum of complications.

A5.text: Laboratory experiments and sporting events like sprints are good examples.
